pkgmetadata.longdescription: Biological Risk Assessment // A spatio-temporal exposure-hazard model for assessing biological risk and impact. The model is based on stochastic geometry for describing the landscape and the exposed individuals, a dispersal kernel for the dissemination of contaminants, a set of tools to handle spatio- temporal dataframe and ecotoxicological equations. Walker E, Leclerc M, Rey JF, Beaudouin R, Soubeyrand S, and Messean A, (2017), A Spatio-Temporal Exposure-Hazard Model for Assessing Biological Risk and Impact, Risk Analysis, doi:10.1111/risa.12941. Leclerc M, Walker E, Messean A, Soubeyrand S (2018), Spatial exposure-hazard and landscape models for assessing the impact of GM crops on non-target organisms, Science of the Total Environment, 624, 470-479.
